summary: Kimchi is a popular Korean side dish made from salted and fermented veggies, usually cabbage or radish. It's seasoned with chili powder, green onions, garlic, ginger, and sometimes fish sauce. Kimchi is served with almost every Korean meal and can also be used in soups and stews. Traditionally, it was stored in special pots underground to control the fermentation process, but now many people use kimchi refrigerators. There are many types of kimchi, each with different vegetables.
title: Kimchi
